text: Hi everyone, I've put some time in the books today at 2pm discuss the code delivered yesterday. I spared a meeting from a few folks, but if you'd like to join, let me know.

Pinning this here: "In terms of what we need from experience side, first and foremost it's ability to control multiple 2-3 ble's at once with on-screen controls and/or accelerometer, as well as the potential music applications. Proximity is something that we all need to talk about, but I feel it's bit more r&d, unless you guys have thoughts on keeping it simple. iOS backgrounding is one thing to spec and consider. I have seen it been (automatic comes to mind) but it's also a battery drain."

text: <@U026NB2U2|marcelino> pinned a message to this channel.
looks like the nRF Toolbox app is the only one they have an iOS project for: <https://github.com/NordicSemiconductor/IOS-nRF-Toolbox>

attachments.title: NordicSemiconductor/IOS-nRF-Toolbox
attachments.text: Contribute to IOS-nRF-Toolbox development by creating an account on GitHub.

text: <@U026PHQ3J> thanks for reminding me about the background modes set in info.plist. I  forgot I had used them twice in my audio app. One for letting audio continue to play/record in the background. The other for trying to upload large recordings to Dropbox (this is not fun).
For BLE in the background the mode is 'Bluetooth-central ' or 'Bluetooth-peripheral'
